sentences: Alban Skënderaj (Albanian: [alˈban skənˈdɛɾaj]; born 20 April 1982) is an Albanian singer, songwriter, composer, actor, producer and television personality.
section: N/A

sentences: Born in Lushnjë and raised in Vlorë, Skënderaj has established himself as a viable artist in Albania and the Albanian-speaking Balkans.
section: N/A

sentences: Beyond his music career, the singer has been featured as a judge on the Albanian television series The X Factor Albania and The Voice of Albania.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings =
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Alban Skënderaj was born on 20 April 1982 into an Albanian family in the city of Lushnjë, then part of the People's Socialist Republic, present Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His father, Qerim Skënderaj, was born in the village of Ninësh, Mallakastër, and has served in the Albanian Armed Forces.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His mother, Afërdita Skënderaj, hailed from Vlorë and died from a serious disease in June 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Skënderaj attended the Halim Xhelo secondary school in Vlorë.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At a young age, his family left Albania for political reasons as part of the Albanian Civil War in 1997 and relocated to Pistoia, Italy.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Skënderaj has three brothers, namely Arbër, Martin and Taulant.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: After relocating to Italy, his brothers encouraged Skënderaj to pursue a music career however, he additionally started to take music lessons and began to play guitar.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Italian composer Sandro Bartolozzi discovered Skënderaj and invited him to the Artestudio53 in Florence, Italy, whereupon he continued to sing with various bands.
section: == Life and career == | === 1982–2004: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===
== Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: After his return in Albania, Alban Skënderaj eventually started to participate in various music contests.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In April 2005, the singer won the 2nd edition of Top Fest with the song "Vetëm ty".
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: A year after, he returned to the 3rd edition of Top Fest, collaborating with the Kosovo-Albanian group Kthjellu on "Diçka", and resulted as the winners of the contest.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In December 2006, he unsuccessfully debuted at Festivali i Këngës at its 45th edition with the song "Eklips".
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: The singer released his second studio album, Melody in October 2008.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: Finishing in second place in December 2010, Skënderaj returned to the contest's 49th edition collaborating with Albanian musician and spouse Miriam Cani on "Ende ka shpresë".
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In November 2012, the singer won the 14th edition of Kënga Magjike with the song "Refuzoj".
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: From 2012 and 2015, he has been a juror for Televizioni Klan's X Factor Albania show.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In November 2014, the singer presented a concert at the Pallati i Kongreseve in Tirana to commemorate the 10th anniversary of his music career.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: Skënderaj's first number-one single, "Une dhe ti", was released in February 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: He released his first live studio album, Tingujt e ditarit tim, in April 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: "Kam nëvoje", his follow-up single featuring Kosovo-Albanian rapper Elinel, also went on to reach number one in Albania in May 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In June 2016, he was honored as the male artist of the year at the Top Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: Three subsequent top 10 singles, "Duart lart", "Engjëll" and "Stoli i trëndafilave", were released in the course of that year.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: As of 2017, Skënderaj served as a coach on the sixth season of Top Channel's The Voice of Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: In June 2017, the singer held a concert to further promote his first live studio album, Tingujt e ditarit tim, at the gardens of the National Library of Kosovo in Pristina.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: Another pair of top 10 singles in Albania, "Dikur", "1000 premtime", "Nuk je vetëm" and "Dhurata", followed throughout 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: The track, "Dhurata" in collaboration with Miriam Cani, was dedicated to their daughter Ameli, which peaked atop the Albanian Top 100 chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===

sentences: Released in 2016, "Une dhe ti" was named as the song of the year at the 2017 Kult Awards in December 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2005–2017: Top Fest and Kënga Magjike ===
== Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: 2018–present: Continued success ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: Skënderaj's chart appearance ensued into May 2018 with the single "Ping Pong" featuring Kosovo-Albanian rapper MC Kresha, which became a top three single in Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: Another charting collaboration titled "Deja vu" with Albanian singer Young Zerka followed in June 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: The follow-up "Lea" became a number-one single in September 2018 and "Nëntor, 26" experienced similar success on its release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: Hapësira e një ëndrre, Skënderaj's second live studio album, was premiered in October 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: Three subsequent top 10 singles, "Plagë në gjysmëshpirt", "Drejt në zemër" and "Duamë", were released in 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===

sentences: Released to positive response, the music video of "Duamë" comprises footage from Skënderaj's marriage ceremony in the Maldives.
section: == Life and career == | === 2018–present: Continued success ===
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: After a music collaboration proposed by Cani's father, Skënderaj started a relationship with German-Albanian singer Miriam Cani in 2007.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On 28 November 2015, Cani gave birth to a daughter, Ameli Skënderaj, on the occasion of Albania's 103rd independence day.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In June 2019, the singer presented a concert as part of his Hapësira e një ëndrre event in Pristina, Kosovo, at which both Cani and Skënderaj performed "Dhurata" and started the performance by revealing she was pregnant.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Their son named Duam Skënderaj was born on 14 January 2020.
section: == Personal life ==
